result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

NO ABUSIVE OR VIOLENT CONTACT WITH P.M.G. OR ANY MEMBERS OF HIS FAMILY.
DO NOT MAKE USE OF ANY PRESCRIPTION MEDICATIONS UNLESS ORDERED BY YOUR PHYSICIAN.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
9:40 AM  Peter Matthew Gorton appears in Court, Atty Travis Satorius, DA Halle Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin.Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Waives reading.  DA Hatch is requesting a $10,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of No violent or abusive contact w/P.M.G. & AS, objection to AS. Court orders as requested w/out the AS. Waive the time limits. Court adjourned at 9:48 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
